intro: Capsella berengeriana, commonly known as mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, white or purple flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it is often found in disturbed soils along roadsides and fields. Capsella berengeriana is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and climates.
